instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
unknow history, no water damage..
board alone:
charging start 5v go up to 20v and the pulse and start over.. look like when he get to 20v he collapse..
PPBUS 12v down to 5v and up again at the pulse..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: no short found..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: What about <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> and other coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
ok one of the usb-c|(near  hdmi port) show charge just on one side...if i upside-down the charger is not show nothing..
can it be UG400? even if it just one of the sides? or there is mosfet for each side?
no short on this area..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
<CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips use internal MOSFETs pair to control the power rail.
Check diode mode to ground on the CC1/2 pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: CC1/2 - both-590

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: <SIGNAL>UPC_BUSPOWER</SIGNAL> full short..001...maybe..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>UPC2_BUSPOWER</SIGNAL> seems to be tied to ground (RG421).

Check diode mode to ground on all JG600's pins; compare with good board, if possible.
Remove USB-C connector from chassis and inspect its terminals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: All JG600's are o.k..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: USB-C meter stays black (no indication at all), when connect power in that port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: look like it short...very low light lashing at the voltmeter...but again just on JG600 and just on one of the sides

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
When change the direction, some pins interchange their position.
CC1/2 and SBU1/2 are first to check.
Data lines only interchange the channels; VBUS don't change (as ground too).

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OUIqvrOPqu5CUDeYcu12n76m5rF36A6X/view?usp=share_link[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: so what i need to looking for?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
"CC1/2 and SBU1/2 are first to check."
Did you compare diode mode readings on these lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
im checking just on JG600 (the problem is just on this port)

<SIGNAL>USBC2_SBU1</SIGNAL>- 615
USBC2-SBU2- 615

USBC2-CC2-CONN - 592
USBC2-CC1-CONN - 597

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
Maybe is better to insist on the other ports first.

If restart when goes to 20V, possibly problem on a secondary voltage.
Which should appear when board tries to boot.

Any chance to test with Magsafe 3 charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
Magsafe 3:
without battery orang light of 1 sec then of to 1 sec and then on and stay...
PPBUS-12v
with battery the orange light flashing on/off all the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
Check other voltages on the board, with Magsafe 3.
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> and small coils around PMUs, <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/8100.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 3.8v
AWAKE 0V no short
PPVDD 0v no short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: Did you check voltage on all coils around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/8100?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> 1.2v
All the rest is 0v

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> 1.8v
All the rest 0v

No short found.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: Check <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/8100 LDOS voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
There is just 1 LDO on <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2SW_CLVR_VDDC1_LDO</SIGNAL> - 0v
"all" the rest LDO'S on the board:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC1</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>2_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PPVDD_LDO_NAND0_OCARINA</SIGNAL> 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2_HDMI_LDO</SIGNAL> 5v
<SIGNAL>P5VS2TPS_PWR_EN_R_LDO</SIGNAL> 1.9v
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_P1V8VDDH_LDO15</SIGNAL> 0v no short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: the orange light on the charger ON then OFF for 2-3sec then ON and stay stable...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
You have various LDOs on <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>; VLDO1/2/4/5/1V8/1V2.
Should be good to check there VCORE too.

Each VLDO has its corresponding <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO</SIGNAL>; check them also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: in the middle of the checking i was notice that the CPU is getting hot...i was disconnect put the fan and the fan start to work, i was said wired but look like is working...i was but the board in the body but then again is dead...put it out again but still dead, so maybe i was touch at something when i was checking the LDO voltage...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
VLDO1 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>) 0.2v                                                                         <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO1</SIGNAL>(<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V
VLDO2 ( <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2SW_CLVR_VDDC1_LDO</SIGNAL>) 0v                                   <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO2</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V   
VLDO3 (NC)                          
VLDO4 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AON</SIGNAL>) 3.3v                                                                     <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO4</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V
VLDO5 (<SIGNAL>PP0V8_S2_CLVR_VDDDIG</SIGNAL>) 0.8v                                              <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO5</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL>) 1.2V
VLDO6 (NC)                                                                        
VLDO1V8 (<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON</SIGNAL>) 1.8V                                                                <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO1V8</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V
VLDO1V2 (<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AON</SIGNAL>) 1.2V                                                                <SIGNAL>VIN_LDO1V2</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V
VCORE (<SIGNAL>PP1V5_AON_VCORE_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 1.5V                                         <SIGNAL>VIN_VCORE</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>) 3.8V

threads.message:
The before mentioned LDOs are stable too?
Any chance to enter DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
o.k i was put the board back and try to put it in DFU the apple logo show for 1-2sec and off.. i was try to put it in recovery mode its say that it preparing to enter but when it need to enter its shot off.
sometimes im getting the "!" sign with support.apple.com/mac/restore
i was able one time to enter to DFU but i was get "error 2006" an i didnt able to enter DFU again.
there is no usb activity..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: Did you try DFU with both Magsafe 3 and battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message: Yea and the charger still with orange light pulsing..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charging pulsing..
threads.message:
May have problems with M1, or SSD.

But there should still be something wrong on the USB-C area of the port with strange behavior.
Compare diode mode readings on more components; between different ports.
